sentences.en: A few of us in the press were there, goggle-eyed at the lavish hospitality.
sentences.cn: 我们几位记者当时在那里，眼馋地看着丰盛的茶点。

sentences.en: A low profile goggle with adjustable nose bridge, as worn by Michael Phelps.
sentences.cn: 低调镜片与可调式鼻桥, 属迈克尔菲尔普斯专用系列.

sentences.en: Both are slick and white and both are equipped with goggle - shaped LCD screens inside.
sentences.cn: 两尊神像均呈现光滑的白色,并配备眼罩式液晶萤幕.

sentences.en: Fashion, comfortable, personality are the mainly specialty of carting goggle.
sentences.cn: 时尚 、 舒适 、 个性是卡丁风镜的最大特色.

sentences.en: He was goggle - eyed Before the exclamatory nature of her feminine characteristics.
sentences.cn: 她的女性特点异常突出,他看得眼睛都发直了.

sentences.en: His eyes seemed to goggle larger than usual behind the heavy lenses.
sentences.cn: 在厚厚的镜片后面,眼睛瞪得比平时大得多.

sentences.en: His insincerity is revealed by the quick goggle of his eyes.
sentences.cn: 他眼睛的快速转动泄露了他的不诚.

sentences.en: Integrated airborne vision goggle is a typical and very complex airborne optical system.
sentences.cn: 综合机载微光夜视镜是一种比较复杂的、典型的机载光电系统.

sentences.en: Johnson stared goggle-eyed at Kravis' sumptuous quarters.
sentences.cn: 约翰逊目瞪口呆地望着克拉维斯的豪宅。

sentences.en: Old Waterline on head is above goggle line on free and lower head on back.
sentences.cn: 老:自时水线在泳镜上线;仰时在较低处.

sentences.en: Pattie Maes, an artificial life researcher at the MIT Media Lab, abhors goggle - and - gloves virtual reality.
sentences.cn: 派蒂?梅斯, 麻省理工学院媒体实验室的一位人工生命研究人员, 极度痛恨那种眼罩 - 手套式的虚拟现实.

sentences.en: Philpot's goggle eyes rolled horribly as he glared silently at the circle and the two squares.
sentences.cn: 菲尔波特一声不响地注视着那个圆圈和那两个正方形,吓人的大眼睛骨碌碌地转个不停.

sentences.en: Put on your safety helmet ( safety harness, safety footwear, safety goggle ear defender ), please.
sentences.cn: 请戴上安全帽 ( 安全带, 安全靴, 护目镜,护耳器 )!

sentences.en: Waterline on head is above goggle line on free and lower head on back.
sentences.cn: 自时水线在泳镜上线;仰时在较低处.

trans.tran_en: Goggles are large glasses that fit closely to your face around your eyes to protect them from such things as water, wind, or dust
to look at something with your eyes wide open in surprise or shock
